abstract: Several super-simple cellular services are so sweet and satisfying, you can’t believe they’re free.
snippet: Several super-simple cellular services are so sweet and satisfying, you can’t believe they’re free.
lead_paragraph: You hear it all the time: “These cellphones are too complicated, by cracky! I don’t want to play music or surf the Internet. I just want to make phone calls!”

headline.main: Cell Services Keep It Easy, and Free
headline.print_headline: Cell Services Keep It Easy, And Free

abstract: The potential $27 billion deal would create the nation’s largest cellular telephone provider.
snippet: The potential $27 billion deal would create the nation’s largest cellular telephone provider.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications is near a deal to buy Alltel for about $27 billion, including the assumption of debt. Vodafone, Verizon’s partner in its wireless business, confirmed the talks in a short statement Thursday, which said Verizon Wireless was in “advanced discussions regarding the potential acquisition of Alltel.”

headline.main: Verizon in Talks to Buy Alltel
headline.print_headline: Alltel Sale To Verizon Looks Likely

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Laura M. Holson

abstract: Verizon Communications is near a deal to buy Alltel for about $27 billion, including the assumption of debt. Vodafone, Verizon’s partner in its wireless business, confirmed the talks in a short statement Thursday, which said Verizon Wireless was in “advanced discussions regarding the potential acquisition of Alltel.”
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications is near a deal to buy Alltel for about $27 billion, including the assumption of debt. Vodafone, Verizon’s partner in its wireless business, confirmed the talks in a short statement Thursday, which said Verizon Wireless was in “advanced discussions regarding the potential acquisition of Alltel.”

headline.main: Vodafone Confirms Verizon Talks to Buy Alltel

abstract: An analyst notes that were Verizon to buy Alltell, it would keep wireless prices high because there is even less competition among cellphone carriers.
snippet: An analyst notes that were Verizon to buy Alltell, it would keep wireless prices high because there is even less competition among cellphone carriers.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes Wall Street is a good place for consumers to understand the world. Just be sure to look through a mirror. Lowering prices to compete for customers put pressure on profit margins, which investors don’t like. They like higher prices, which hurt consumers.

headline.main: Verizon-Alltel and the March of Oligopoly

abstract: Seven months after buying it, the private-equity owners of Alltel have agreed to sell the company to Verizon Wireless for $28.1 billion, including assumed debt. Verizon announced the deal in a press release Thursday morning, following reports that the two wireless providers were in advanced talks about a potential transaction.
lead_paragraph: Seven months after buying it, the private-equity owners of Alltel have agreed to sell the company to Verizon Wireless for $28.1 billion, including assumed debt. Verizon announced the deal in a press release Thursday morning, following reports that the two wireless providers were in advanced talks about a potential transaction.

headline.main: Verizon Reaches $28 Billion Deal for Alltel
